sentences.en: Analysts claim that the firm’s assets were undervalued by £300 million.
sentences.cn: 分析员称公司资产被低估了三亿英镑。

sentences.en: And remember, do not undervalue the element of surprise.
sentences.cn: 记住啦, 别低估突然袭击的作用.

sentences.en: Avoid a tendency to undervalue yourself and your ability to make a worthwhile contribution.
sentences.cn: 得避免低估自己与能力的倾向,来作出意义非凡的贡献.

sentences.en: Cherish your own emotions and never undervalue them.
sentences.cn: 珍视你自己的感情,切勿低估它的价值.

sentences.en: Don't undervalue Jim's contribution to the research.
sentences.cn: 不要低估了吉姆在研究工作中的贡献.

sentences.en: Holmes thinks that snobbery is the biggest obstacle to improving sales. People undervalue salespeople.
sentences.cn: 霍姆斯认为,欺下谄上是妨碍销售额提高的罪魁祸首, 人们轻视销售人员.

sentences.en: Like liberty, gold never stays where it is undervalue.
sentences.cn: 像自由一样, 黄金从不留在不受重视的地方.

sentences.en: Magnification ( Minimization ): refers to the tendency to exaggerate ( undervalue ) the importance of a negative ( positive ) event.
sentences.cn: [跨大 ( 缩小 ) ]: 即指倾向跨大负面或 缩小 正面事情的重要性.

sentences.en: Maybe Lyons thought we undervalue - d him, but that's their decision.
sentences.cn: 也许里昂认为我们低估了他, 但那是他们的决定.

sentences.en: Reforms that undervalue these contributions are likely to do far more harm than good.
sentences.cn: 低估这些改善的贡献价值将弊大于利.

sentences.en: Society undervalues staying at home and looking after children.
sentences.cn: 社会低估了待在家里照看孩子的意义。

sentences.en: Still , we must not undervalue Aristotle's contribution.
sentences.cn: 我们也不能低估——亚里士多德的贡献.

sentences.en: This is not so easy to see going on. And very easy to undervalue.
sentences.cn: 而这个进展不那么容易看到, 而且也很容易忽视.

sentences.en: Too many people overvalue what they are not and undervalue what they are.
sentences.cn: 有太多的人高估他们所欠缺的,却又低估了他们所拥有的.

sentences.en: We generally tend to overvalue money and undervalue art.
sentences.cn: 我们一般倾向于把金钱看得过重而低估艺术的价值.
我们决不能低估自由的价值。

sentences.en: You may over evaluate the accomplishments of others, and undervalue yours.
sentences.cn: 你可能过度看重他人的成就, 并且低估自己的.

trans.tran_en: to think that someone or something is less important or valuable than they really are
